verses.2: "Listen carefully to my words; let this be the consolation you give me.
verses.3: Bear with me while I speak, and after I have spoken, mock on.
verses.4: "Is my complaint directed to man? Why should I not be impatient?
verses.5: Look at me and be astonished; clap your hand over your mouth.
verses.6: When I think about this, I am terrified; trembling seizes my body.
verses.7: Why do the wicked live on, growing old and increasing in power?
verses.8: They see their children established around them, their offspring before their eyes.
verses.9: Their homes are safe and free from fear; the rod of God is not upon them.
verses.10: Their bulls never fail to breed; their cows calve and do not miscarry.
verses.11: They send forth their children as a flock; their little ones dance about.
verses.12: They sing to the music of tambourine and harp; they make merry to the sound of the flute.
verses.13: They spend their years in prosperity and go down to the grave in peace.
verses.14: Yet they say to God, 'Leave us alone! We have no desire to know your ways.
verses.15: Who is the Almighty, that we should serve him? What would we gain by praying to him?'
verses.17: "Yet how often is the lamp of the wicked snuffed out? How often does calamity come upon them, the fate God allots in his anger?
verses.16: But their prosperity is not in their own hands, so I stand aloof from the counsel of the wicked.
verses.19: It is said, 'God stores up a man's punishment for his sons.' Let him repay the man himself, so that he will know it!
verses.18: How often are they like straw before the wind, like chaff swept away by a gale?
verses.21: For what does he care about the family he leaves behind when his allotted months come to an end?
verses.20: Let his own eyes see his destruction; let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.23: One man dies in full vigor, completely secure and at ease,
verses.22: "Can anyone teach knowledge to God, since he judges even the highest?
verses.25: Another man dies in bitterness of soul, never having enjoyed anything good.
verses.24: his body well nourished, his bones rich with marrow.
verses.27: "I know full well what you are thinking, the schemes by which you would wrong me.
verses.26: Side by side they lie in the dust, and worms cover them both.
verses.29: Have you never questioned those who travel? Have you paid no regard to their accounts-
verses.28: You say, 'Where now is the great man's house, the tents where wicked men lived?'
verses.31: Who denounces his conduct to his face? Who repays him for what he has done?
verses.30: that the evil man is spared from the day of calamity, that he is delivered from the day of wrath?
verses.34: "So how can you console me with your nonsense? Nothing is left of your answers but falsehood!"
verses.32: He is carried to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb.
verses.33: The soil in the valley is sweet to him; all men follow after him, and a countless throng goes before him.
